title.rendered: The Future of Organ Donation…3D Printing?

content.rendered:
The future of organ donation is 3D printing.

Jenny Morber a freelance science writer took an amazing look at how Organovo, amongst others, is leading the charge to change the organ donation landscape.

Veterans of 3D printing know firsthand the amazing feeling of seeing their creation come to life. But now imagine the feeling that comes with watching your 3D-printed creation actually save a life. The team at Organovo is looking to create those moments and ensure many of the struggles that exist with organ donation potentially disappear.

These exciting developments are still most likely years or decades away but progress is being made every day. Dr. Bolan, of Clemson University, is pioneering this technology and he currently uses 3D printers to build complex shapes off sample blueprints. The research needed to construct a heart already exists but scientists need 3D printers to build the “scaffolding” so they can bathe it in the nutrients and cells from a healthy organ. This technology is so cutting edge it seems to come from a science fiction novel and not the research lab of a university.

However, for those of us in the 3D printing space, this truth is much more exciting. Every day we are solving engineering problems and finding solutions that make us more efficient. And in the future, many of those solutions could turn out to be latterly live-saving.

To follow Jenny Morber on Twitter check her out http://www.twitter.com/JRMorber
